questions.text: Where did Kramer find the statue?
questions.explanation:
In a box.

	The box was full of clothes and useless keepsakes that Jerry's grandfather used to own.  Kramer roots through it in case there's anything he wants.

questions.text: Who once had a statue that looked the exact same as the one that was found?
questions.explanation:
George.

	George accidentally broke it and his parents got mad at him, so Kramer gives it to George.

questions.text: Who is the novelist of the book Elaine is editing?
questions.explanation:
Rava.

	Rava is from Finland and she specifically wanted Elaine to edit the book.  Otherwise, Rava said, she'd leave and go to a different publisher.

questions.text: Who is the person who cleans Jerry's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Ray.

	Ray is Rava's boyfriend, and he ends up cleaning the house beyond Jerry's expectations.

questions.text: What is the last name of Elaine's boss?
questions.explanation:
Lippman & Lipman.

	This is the first episode in which Elaine's boss at Pendant Publishing is mentioned.  Mr. Lippman is not seen in this episode.

questions.text: Who is with Jerry in his cleaner's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Elaine.

	Jerry finds the statue of a woman inside Ray and Rava's apartment and tells Elaine, but she doesn't think Ray would steal it.

questions.text: Who stays in Monk's with Jerry while he meets with his cleaner?
questions.explanation:
George.

	On the DVD feature "Notes About Nothing", the notes say that Elaine was originally supposed to be in the scene seated next to George and wearing a funny hat so that she isn't noticed.

questions.text: Does the book that Elaine edits get published?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Elaine ends up throwing the manuscript out after arguing with Rava over whether or not Ray stole the statue from Jerry's apartment.

questions.text: Who poses as a cop to get the statue from the cleaner's apartment?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	Kramer uses the clothes he get from the box of Jerry's grandfather's things to make Ray think that he's a cop.

questions.text: Did the cleaner steal the statue?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Kramer gets the statue back from Ray and gives it to George, but George drops the statue after Kramer smacks him on the back.
